info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 7:52PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 830 PM MST... At 751 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Downtown Mesa, or near Mesa, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Scottsdale, Gilbert, Tempe, Fountain Hills, East Mesa, Mesa Riverview Mall, Tempe Marketplace, Granite Reef Dam, Falcon Field Airport, Salt River Indian Community, Downtown Mesa, Freestone Park, Downtown Scottsdale, Arizona State University and Fiesta Mall. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 174 and 187. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 171 and 193. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 7 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
